Fural cats are also reported to be in the millions but the predators. Pet cats kill at least 1.12 million native birds a year. A lot of this is to do with the fact that our bird life and actually all of our wildlife has evolved in the absence of mammalian predators. This isn't about being anti-cat, this is about being pro- our wildlife and protecting them. New Zealand may be sitting on their paws on this, but in Australia there are big moves.
